item.title: Making npc's talk [STILL NOT SOLVED! PLEASE HELP!]
item.dc:creator: @warlordtt warlordtt
item.description:
@warlordtt wrote:

Sorry, i don’t remember anything about 317 scripting, but i DO remember that its not hard to make them say anything, a possibility could be if there is a NPC on your server already saying something, try to search for it on Windows Explorer, in your server folder…

For example you got a NPC saying: I sell delicious chickens!

Then you could search for delicious and the .java file should pop right up in your eyes.

item.title: Making npc's talk [STILL NOT SOLVED! PLEASE HELP!]
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

I’m trying to get npc’s to say lines out loud and I have this:

	if (npcs[i].npcType == 659) {
                        if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) {
                            npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
                            npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
                            npcs[i].textUpdate = "test";
                           }
        		return true;

But when I compile, I get this:

NPCHandler.java:3502: class, interface, or enum expected if (npcs[i].npcType == 659) { ^ NPCHandler.java:3505: class, interface, or enum expected npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; ^ NPCHandler.java:3506: class, interface, or enum expected npcs[i].textUpdate = "test"; ^ NPCHandler.java:3507: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ 4 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

HELP!

Read full topic
item.source: Making npc's talk [STILL NOT SOLVED! PLEASE HELP!]
